what: Functionality for non-compartmental analysis using PKNCA
title: Functionality for non-compartmental analysis using PKNCA
text: PKNCA.extra provides convenience functions running non-compartmental analyses using PKNCA. intention package substitute improve existing functionality within PKNCA, merely make easier efficient use providing convenient wrapper functions.

what: PKNCA.extra: Functionality for non-compartmental analysis using PKNCA — PKNCA.extra-package
title: PKNCA.extra: Functionality for non-compartmental analysis using PKNCA — PKNCA.extra-package
text: Provides functions perform NCAs using PKNCA package underlying computational engine. PKNCA package provides great stable computational engine, somewhat limited (design) features provides data (pre-)processing interpretation NCA results. package offers functionality.

what: Check that grouping specified to PKNCA is likely to be correct If the grouping results in most groups having too few datapoints to perform NCA and calculate half-life, then the grouping is likely wrong. — check_nca_grouping
title: Check that grouping specified to PKNCA is likely to be correct If the grouping results in most groups having too few datapoints to perform NCA and calculate half-life, then the grouping is likely wrong. — check_nca_grouping
text: Check grouping specified PKNCA likely correct grouping results groups datapoints perform NCA calculate half-life, grouping likely wrong.

title: Check that grouping specified to PKNCA is likely to be correct If the grouping results in most groups having too few datapoints to perform NCA and calculate half-life, then the grouping is likely wrong. — check_nca_grouping
code: check_nca_grouping(   data,   groups,   dictionary,   settings = list(),   threshold = 0.7,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Check that grouping specified to PKNCA is likely to be correct If the grouping results in most groups having too few datapoints to perform NCA and calculate half-life, then the grouping is likely wrong. — check_nca_grouping
text: data dataset pre-parse format, preferrably created using create_nca_data(). Can also NONMEM-style dataset EVID=0|1 column indicating PK dosing data. groups optional grouping variable, e.g. ACTARM. dictionary abridged data dictionary input dataset, specified list object. Requires least entries subject_id, time, conc, dose. Optional entries : visit. required entries specified partially, default values (.e. CDISC) nomenclature imputed missing identifiers. settings list settings NCA. Provided setting names can either settings recognized directly pknca, settings included map provided nca_settings_map() (mapped pknca setting names). threshold fraction data allowed data points NCA. verbose verbose output?

title: Check that grouping specified to PKNCA is likely to be correct If the grouping results in most groups having too few datapoints to perform NCA and calculate half-life, then the grouping is likely wrong. — check_nca_grouping

what: Create a table for NCA results — create_nca_table
title: Create a table for NCA results — create_nca_table
text: Confirms layout table commonly used PK reports, .e. stats outputted long format using single column.

title: Create a table for NCA results — create_nca_table
code: create_nca_table(   nca_data,   parameters = NULL,   groups = NULL,   path = NULL,   format = c("wide", "long"),   style = c("simple", "pretty"),   specification = "default",   description = TRUE,   prefix = NULL,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Create a table for NCA results — create_nca_table
text: nca_data output data NCA, generated using run_nca() parameters vector parameters output, e.g. c("AUCALL", "CMAX", "TMAX"). NULL, defaults output available parameters. groups name variable dataset group statistics , e.g. "ACTARM" path optional, path filename save output table . format output table wide long format. style style output table. Default simple, output essentially regular data.frame can easily used parsing. pretty style intended printing inclusion reports: multiple rows table single parameter interval, leave blanks subsequent rows parameter description. specification specification file settings NCA. Needs match specification used run_nca() properly map column names. description include description parameter names table? prefix prefix column names , e.g. superpos_. verbose Verbose?

title: Create a table for NCA results — create_nca_table
text: data.frame tibble.

what: When PKNCA::PKNCA.options() is invoked without arguments, it will return a list of its configuration. Among the options is the data.frame single.dose.aucs which will list the exported PK parameters for both the AUC0-24 and AUCinf computations. Wherever the parameters are set to TRUE PKNCA will compute those and include in output. So in that case we can use those parameters as well and should make them available in the output from run_nca(). — get_pk_parameters_from_pknca_options
title: When PKNCA::PKNCA.options() is invoked without arguments, it will return a list of its configuration. Among the options is the data.frame single.dose.aucs which will list the exported PK parameters for both the AUC0-24 and AUCinf computations. Wherever the parameters are set to TRUE PKNCA will compute those and include in output. So in that case we can use those parameters as well and should make them available in the output from run_nca(). — get_pk_parameters_from_pknca_options
text: PKNCA::PKNCA.options() invoked without arguments, return list configuration. Among options data.frame single.dose.aucs list exported PK parameters AUC0-24 AUCinf computations. Wherever parameters set TRUE PKNCA compute include output. case can use parameters well make available output run_nca().

title: When PKNCA::PKNCA.options() is invoked without arguments, it will return a list of its configuration. Among the options is the data.frame single.dose.aucs which will list the exported PK parameters for both the AUC0-24 and AUCinf computations. Wherever the parameters are set to TRUE PKNCA will compute those and include in output. So in that case we can use those parameters as well and should make them available in the output from run_nca(). — get_pk_parameters_from_pknca_options

When PKNCA::PKNCA.options() is invoked without arguments, it will return a list of its configuration. Among the options is the data.frame single.dose.aucs which will list the exported PK parameters for both the AUC0-24 and AUCinf computations. Wherever the parameters are set to TRUE PKNCA will compute those and include in output. So in that case we can use those parameters as well and should make them available in the output from run_nca(). — get_pk_parameters_from_pknca_options
text: options parameters interval specification NCA no_dots TRUE (default) replace dots parameter names (e.g. aucinf.obs) underscores (aucinf_obs).

Run a non-compartmental analysis — run_nca
text: function runs NCA pre-parsed dataset. NCA performed using PKNCA package. NCA output object saved rds file path specified.

title: Run a non-compartmental analysis — run_nca
code: run_nca(   data,   dose_data = NULL,   specification = "default",   dictionary = NULL,   settings = NULL,   blq = "<",   groups = NULL,   include_cols = NULL,   intervals = data.frame(start = 0, end = Inf),   partial_auc = NULL,   exclude_points = NULL,   exclude_subjects = NULL,   sequence_from = NULL,   add_auctau = TRUE,   post = list(accumulation = list(parameters = c("auctau", "cmax"))),   no_dots = TRUE,   path = NULL,   check_grouping = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Run a non-compartmental analysis — run_nca
text: data dataset pre-parse format, preferrably created using create_nca_data(). Can also NONMEM-style dataset EVID=0|1 column indicating PK dosing data. dose_data optional, data.frame dosing info. Useful multi-dose NCAs. Alternative specifying NONMEM-style datasett data. specification use specific options NCA mapping input / output data. dictionary abridged data dictionary input dataset, specified list object. Requires least entries subject_id, time, conc, dose. Optional entries : visit. required entries specified partially, default values (.e. CDISC) nomenclature imputed missing identifiers. settings list settings NCA. Provided setting names can either settings recognized directly pknca, settings included map provided nca_settings_map() (mapped pknca setting names). blq optional, string match concentration data, e.g. "<" "BLQ>. conc column data character class, blq NULL, detect values match string set values zero. NULL, conc data numeric, data used -. groups optional grouping variable, e.g. ACTARM. include_cols Optional. Character vector column names data merged NCA results (including single value row). Merge happen subject ID, supplied groupings, nca_start time. intervals specify time intervals NCA calculations. passed argument data.frame, least start end time row specifies interval. Inf allowed specify end interval. Example:   run_nca() function compute parameters specified settings() default settings. partial_auc data.frame containing least start end time row specifies start- endtime partial AUC calculation. least AUC_0-t (auclast) calculated row. parameters specified data.frame column also calculated, e.g. cmax=TRUE. Currently, single row can supplied argument. exclude_points list points exclude, based name(s) list match column name input dataset. E.g. list("sample_id" = c("12345", "23456")). similarly used exclude entire subjects, e.g. list("subject_id = c("103, "105") exclude_subjects description... sequence_from optional. Argument specify column name indicates treatment e.g. food-effect cross-trials. add sequence group sequence description columns output data. add_auctau compute AUCtau whenever relevant? TRUE (default) / FALSE. multi-dose PK data, add parameter auc_tau NCA output data AUC interval. essence, just make copy AUClast interval. See exact logic function help page. post named list lists, indicating hard-coded post-processing steps include, options step. Possible post-processing steps include: accumulation: NCA calculated multiple non-overlapping intervals, add accumulation ratios parameters listed parameters argument NCA output table interval. options may added future. Default : list("accumulation" = list("parameters" = c("auclast", "cmax"))). no_dots TRUE (default) replace dots parameter names (e.g. aucinf.obs) underscores (aucinf_obs). path path file store output object PKNCA RDS (optional) check_grouping check whether grouping specified groups likely correct NCA, creating groups small NCA able calculate half-life parameters. See check_nca_grouping() details. verbose verbose output? ... parameters passed `PKNCA::pk.nca()“ function.
code: intervals = bind_rows(    c(start = 0, end = 24),    c(start = 120, end = Inf) )

title: Run a non-compartmental analysis — run_nca
text: four possible types input datasets can used run NCA: Using separate data.frame PK data (data) dose data (dose_data), PK dosing event row respective datasedt. Can used single multi-dose data. Using single data.frame PK dose data (data), event type separated using evid column (specified dictionary). PK data rows set evid=0, doses evid=1. essentially NONMEM-style dataset. Rows evid values ignored. Can used single multi-dose data, dosing occasions determined dosing events. evid column present data, attempt use approach 3. Using single data.frame (data) PK data rows, column dose (colum name specified dictionary). dose_data data.frame constructed dose column. Can used single-dose data, unless groups used separate dosing occasions. Using single data.frame (data) PK data rows, dosing info data. NCA can still compute AUC Cmax etc, parameters require dose CL, V, etc returned NA. Can used single dose, unless groups used separate dosing occasions.

title: Run a non-compartmental analysis — run_nca

what: Run an NCA on superpositioned data, either just extrapolated to steady state for the current dose levels, or using linear extrapolation to a different dose and interval. — run_nca_superposition
title: Run an NCA on superpositioned data, either just extrapolated to steady state for the current dose levels, or using linear extrapolation to a different dose and interval. — run_nca_superposition
text: Run NCA superpositioned data, either just extrapolated steady state current dose levels, using linear extrapolation different dose interval.

title: Run an NCA on superpositioned data, either just extrapolated to steady state for the current dose levels, or using linear extrapolation to a different dose and interval. — run_nca_superposition
code: run_nca_superposition(   data,   dose_data = NULL,   regimen,   dictionary,   parameters = c("auclast", "cmax"),   groups = c(),   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run an NCA on superpositioned data, either just extrapolated to steady state for the current dose levels, or using linear extrapolation to a different dose and interval. — run_nca_superposition
text: data dataset pre-parse format, preferrably created using create_nca_data(). Can also NONMEM-style dataset EVID=0|1 column indicating PK dosing data. dose_data optional, data.frame dosing info. Useful multi-dose NCAs. Alternative specifying NONMEM-style datasett data. regimen list specifies least interval, potentially dose. E.g. list(interval = 8) calculate steady state concentration data using superposition. dose also specified, scale superposition data linearly compared original input dose, e.g. list(dose = 500, interval = 12). dictionary abridged data dictionary input dataset, specified list object. Requires least entries subject_id, time, conc, dose. Optional entries : visit. required entries specified partially, default values (.e. CDISC) nomenclature imputed missing identifiers. parameters description... groups optional grouping variable, e.g. ACTARM. verbose verbose output?

title: Run an NCA on superpositioned data, either just extrapolated to steady state for the current dose levels, or using linear extrapolation to a different dose and interval. — run_nca_superposition
text: PKNCA output object based superposition data

title: PKNCA.extra (development version)
text: Initial CRAN submission.
